frameDefinitions: An Agent has an Attribute which can take different Values, and the Agent selects and then begins to use some Value for that Attribute.
A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor. ''
An Agent expends effort towards achieving a Goal.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer believing that some Phenomenon will take place in the future.
AForgoer decides not to partake in something ordinary that is otherwise Desirable.
A Speaker addresses a Proposal made by an Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it.
frameExamples: They scoff at their opponents and <t>assume</t> an air of superior knowledge
They <t>agreed</t> to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper.
In addition, our organization will <t>work</t> on improving accountability in every department.
They were <t>rebuffed</t> again in the larger city of Provo. CNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> selects a <fen>Value</fen> for his/her <fen>Attribute</fen> and begins to use it.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen> can take on several <fen>Value</fen>s, selected by the <fen>Agent</fen> .
The <fen>Value</fen>, chosen and made effective by the <fen>Agent</fen>, specifies the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The time period when the <fen>Agent</fen> selects and begins to put into effect the <fen>Value</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> has the <fen>Attribute</fen> which can take different <fen>Value</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made.
This is the person who proposed the <fen>Proposed_action</fen>  to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response.
The <fen>Proposed_action</fen> is an action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response concerning the proposed action.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  gives their verbal response to the proposed action.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts effort into reaching <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> expends effort to achieve.
An entity that is centrally involved in the <fen>Goal</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to acheive.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the effort occurs.
The place where the work is done.

This is the person who believes some Phenomenon will take place in the future. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: <fex name='Cognizer'>Pat</fex> <t>expects</t> that the Yankees will win the World Series.

This is what the Cognizer believes will happen in the future. It can be expressed as a Finite Clause Complement, an NP Object, or a VP Complement with or without an NP Object (see General Grammatical Observations):
An entity that serves as the focus of a predicted <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the prediction.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> foresees the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Forgoer</fen> decides not to partake in the desirable activity or event.
<fen>Desirable</fen> identifies the event or activity in which is the <fen>Forgoer</fen> does not partake.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the the forgoing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the forgoing occurs.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates the reply or response.

This is the person who made the <fen>Proposal</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the <fen>Proposal</fen> and is only licensed when the <fen>Proposal</fen>  can be understood from the context.
The <fen>Proposal</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Some organizations, like the Sierra Club</fex>, have adopted a position of neutrality on US immigration policies.
The Council of Constance (1414-18) adopted conciliarism <fex>as a stance</fex>, hoping that it would permit the election of a pope acceptable to both Catholic factions.
He crammed his cap back again into his pocket and re-entered the office, assuming <fex>an air of absentmindedness</fex>.
<fex>On January 1, 2001</fex>, our nation will adopt the US dollar as our official currency.
Pat expects <fex>that the Yankees will win the World Series</fex>.
Predictions <fex>about stock prices</fex> are notoriously undependable.
She predicted the outcry <fex>several months ago</fex>.
<fex>Even at the far side of the house</fex> I could predict what was going on the kitchen.
<fex>Iran</fex> on Saturday rejected Europe's proposal for ending the standoff over Tehran's nuclear program.

But senior SLN officials had rebuffed <fex>the man who is ever so willing to please
the guerrillas</fex>.
Dr. Carolyn Herrington has accepted <fex>our offer to become Dean of the College of Education</fex> .
This must make <fex>yesterday's</fex> Taliban rebuff all the more wounding.
Legislation that would have required smaller school districts to share administrators has been rebuffed repeatedly <fex>in the Oklahoma House of Representatives</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Sherlock Holmes and the Incident at Victoria Falls
The Hollow Crown and Pleasure and Repentance
The Long and the Short and the Tall (1961
the King's Own Yorkshire Light Infantry
